result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:33 PM Defendant Joshua Allen Silverman in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address updated.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $3000 with conditions. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.R.S., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with Co Defendant Anne Marie Bieneman. No possession of any weapons including firearms.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 3:00 PM.
